intro: Mammillaria nejapensis, commonly known as the Nejapén Cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape. The plant features prominent areoles covered with white, silky hairs, and it produces yellow flowers during the spring season. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
